column4: Hints for resizing windows; defrag is usually a good idea. Cleanly slosing Windows before you boot the live CD is ESSENTIAL.

the ubuntu installer will NOT try to resize your NTFS unless it is absloutely in order. If you get even a little bit into booting windows, you must let it finiosh then cleanly shut down again from the menu.
Not entirely, I'm running quite happily on one.
